full_threads.body:
Hi Sylvia,

Sounds like a plan. We've set up a reminder on our end too.

Also, thanks for confirming the pop up design on the separate thread.

Let us know if you need anything else!

Cheers,
Andy

That looks great. Ok for xmas day.

Director/Principal Physio
Lively Physiotherapy & Pilates Studio

'feel balanced, be healthy, become lively'

Hi Sylvia,

Absolutely - we definitely want to make sure you are happy with the look before anything is finalized.

Please find the design preview attached.
Our designer built this using the Center Box layout we discussed. As requested, it includes:
  • The specific contact details (0466 785 820  & admin@livelyphysio.com.au ).
  • A prominent "Book Online" button.

Next Step: Does this look good to you? If you give the green light, I will schedule it immediately to go live automatically on Christmas Day.

Yes pls show me first before launching it.

Regards,
Sylvia

Lively Physiotherapy & Pilates Studio

Perfect - thanks for confirming! We’ll proceed with the Clean & Minimal (Center Box) design and will send it over once it’s ready and scheduled for Christmas Day.

Thanks again!

Hi Adriane,

Yes, let's go with the first option.

Regards,
Sylvia

Hi Sylvia,

I’m Adriane from the Wolf IQ support team. I’m getting everything ready to schedule your "Coming Soon" notice for Christmas Day.

Since we haven't designed the custom pop-up yet, I wanted to check which layout style you prefer so we can build it to match your vision.

Could you take a quick look at these examples and let me know which "vibe" fits best?
  1. Clean & Minimal (Center Box): A simple white box in the middle of the screen. Very professional and ensures the text is easy to read.

  2. Full Screen Overlay: Covers the whole page with a background color/image. This is very bold and ensures no one misses the message.

  3. Top Banner: A bar that stays at the top of the screen. Less intrusive, but allows users to still browse the old site if they want.

My recommendation: I suggest the Center Box style. It's polite but noticeable, and gives us plenty of space to make the "Book Online" button really stand out without blocking the entire site background.

Let me know your preference, and we’ll get that built and scheduled!

Ok thank you. Ill send out a reminder to support team on 24th Dec. We will leave the pop up there until further notice.

Thanks Andy.

Director/Principal Physio
Lively Physiotherapy & Pilates Studio

'feel balanced, be healthy, become lively'

full_threads.body:
Hi Sylvia,

Perfect, thanks for the date and the clarity on the next steps.

@Wolf IQ Support will handle scheduling the pop-up notice to go live on Christmas Day (December 25th).

We will ensure your contact details (0466 785 820 and admin@livelyphysio.com.au) are included, and the 'Book online' link remains active.

Regarding the new colors, we can wait until everything is ready. Have a great holiday break and good luck with Tim!

Thanks,
Andy

Hi Andy,

So the pop up notice on the website can go up xmas day. Please have our contact details on it and ensure patients can still book online.

On February 9th, we have photo day with Tim Pascoe.

Do you want to start working on the new colours etc? I have the branding kit from my graphic designer.... or wait until the new pictures and do it all then?

Regards,
Sylvia

Hi Sylvia,

Thanks for the update - sounds like everything's coming together nicely.

We'll hold off on updating the logo for now and instead pop a homepage notice up in the meantime:
"New website coming soon! Please call 0466 785 820 or email admin@livelyphysio.com.au for any questions."

We'll also keep the Book Online link active as requested.

Just send through the final logo files when ready and we'll take it from there.

Cheers,
Andy

On Sun, Nov 9, 2025 at 4:13 PM Sylvia Yong-Gonzales <sylvia@livelyphysio.com.au> wrote:
Hi Andy,

So the new logo is almost finalised. I will be sending the artworks to the printer for our signages, which takes 2-3 weeks for printing production before we change our signages at the clinic. We aren't physically moving the pilates equipment until Dec 23rd, and opening on Jan 5th. I plan to then take new pictures and videos with Tim then. My question to you is, are you able to change the website to the new logo and the colour scheme before Tim does the new photos? Or can you put on our homepage 'New website coming, please call 0466 785 820 or email admin@livelyphysio.com.au for any questions. And keep the 'Book online' link available also?

I just don't want our new logo up at the clinic but the website still has the old logo. Doesn't look professional and may cause some confusion.

Regards,
Sylvia
